headline: Rep. Warren Davidson to Newsmax: Calls for K-3 Sex Ed ‘Mind Blowing’
author: NationalWatch
sentences:
Rep. Warren Davidson to Newsmax: Calls for K-3 Sex Ed 'Mind Blowing' (Newsmax/"National Report")
By Eric Mack | Monday, 11 April 2022 08:20 PM
While Democrats are complaining Republicans are seeking to pass legislation to keep public schools from teaching sex education to elementary school kids, Rep. Warren Davidson, R-Ohio, told Newsmax it is "mind blowing" such laws are even needed.

Davidson is also a part of a GOP-led lawsuit against the Centers for Disease Control and the Transportation Security Administration to stop the mandates of face masks on airline travelers, taking a shot at Dr. Anthony Fauci for imposing mandates on Americans without authority.

"It's really odd that we would even need to pass a bill that says you don't do sex education with kindergartners through third-graders," Davidson told Monday's "National Report."
"New Jersey's planning on intentionally including that in the curriculum for their kindergarten through third-graders: This is mind blowing," Davidson told host Rob Finnerty.
Frankly, even our own State Department early on offered Zelenskyy a ride out of the country, and Zelenskyy boldly said, 'I don't need a ride, I need ammunition.'
Davidson rebuked Democrats' opposition to age-appropriate sex education, noting some Democrats are even looking to codify it in their states.
"They don't have the authority to issue this mandate, which means the TSA doesn't have the authority to enforce it," Davidson said.
Davidson is running for reelection in Ohio's 8th District, facing Phil Heimlich in the GOP House primary, and voting is underway.
